page.title: 05Climate,Weather,Countryside
page.content: The climate in Cardross is a result of its position in Scotland. It is kept warm by the Gulf Stream and wet from the westerly winds which mass over the Atlantic Ocean. The village gets so much rain because Cardross is on the edge of the Highland Line. Much rain falls on the hills. The countryside surrounding Cardross is very beautiful. The land is mainly farmland but there are many deciduous trees and shrubs on the lowland,heather and bracken high on the hills. There are many rights of way which the Cardross Community Council have fought to keep open. The River Clyde flows along the shores of Cardross, with its oyster catchers, seagulls, mussels, crabs and seaweed a daily sight.
